issue.title: DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns

content.raw: Have you been testing with the latest polaris model ([gazebo_models pull request 25](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/25)) and the latest vehicle plugin (pull request #238)?
content.html: Have you been testing with the latest polaris model (gazebo_models pull request 25) and the latest vehicle plugin (pull request #238)?

issue.title: DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns

content.raw:
Just tried it out using gazebo_models pull request 25 and the vehicle does turn sharper, but also fishtails a lot more and is less consistent.  I ran an automated program in which the vehicle perform various trajectories and recorded the results.  

It is worth noting that we did not use the latest vehicle plug in and instead used a modification which made it behave like an older version.  The steering wheel angle is directly set instead of specifying a force.  We will try out the new vehicle plugin soon.  Don't think this difference should change the vehicle's kinematics...
content.html:
Just tried it out using gazebo_models pull request 25 and the vehicle does turn sharper, but also fishtails a lot more and is less consistent. I ran an automated program in which the vehicle perform various trajectories and recorded the results.

It is worth noting that we did not use the latest vehicle plug in and instead used a modification which made it behave like an older version. The steering wheel angle is directly set instead of specifying a force. We will try out the new vehicle plugin soon. Don't think this difference should change the vehicle's kinematics...

issue.title: DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns

content.raw: The vehicle model doesn't have a rigid steering linkage, rather it uses the steering wheel angle as a reference command for the front wheels, with an Ackerman compensation between the left and right wheels. It could be that the gains are not high enough for the front wheel steering controller. I'll look into that.
content.html: The vehicle model doesn't have a rigid steering linkage, rather it uses the steering wheel angle as a reference command for the front wheels, with an Ackerman compensation between the left and right wheels. It could be that the gains are not high enough for the front wheel steering controller. I'll look into that.

issue.title: DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns

content.raw: Polaris trajectories generated from latest version of polaris_test branch.  Both forward and backwards motions were tested.  Forward motion last 2500 (ms) at max velocity and backwards 1500 (ms). All steering angles from -PI to PI are tested in both direction.  After performing a trajectory the breaks are applied for 2000 (ms) and then the steering wheel placed in the neutral position 0 radians.  After that the next trajectory is tested.
content.html: Polaris trajectories generated from latest version of polaris_test branch. Both forward and backwards motions were tested. Forward motion last 2500 (ms) at max velocity and backwards 1500 (ms). All steering angles from -PI to PI are tested in both direction. After performing a trajectory the breaks are applied for 2000 (ms) and then the steering wheel placed in the neutral position 0 radians. After that the next trajectory is tested.

issue.title: DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns

content.raw:
See the attachment that I just added showing trajectories.  It still does some strange things occationally.  Backwards trajectories aren't run as long as forward ones since typically you just want it to be quick sharp turn when in reverse.

I didn't change the steering commands from the old version.  Does the steering wheel no longer instantly change?  I actually expected my code to fail and was surprised when it worked.
content.html:
See the attachment that I just added showing trajectories. It still does some strange things occationally. Backwards trajectories aren't run as long as forward ones since typically you just want it to be quick sharp turn when in reverse.

I didn't change the steering commands from the old version. Does the steering wheel no longer instantly change? I actually expected my code to fail and was surprised when it worked.

issue.title: DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns

content.raw: I fixed some of the steering behavior in the latest version of the plugin. So do you consider this issue resolved, or would you like to elaborate on "It still does some strange things occasionally"?

issue.title: DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns

content.raw:
Still need to do more testing, but I can see two issues from the limited testing that I have done already.

1)  If you look at the trajectories above you can see one is very different from the others.  it shouldn't diverge like that in such a controlled environment.  
2) The turn radius still way to large.  Not having a polaris ranger handy, I did a search online and found a message board [1] where people posted a turn diameter of around 13 and 14 feet for the 800 and 850 models.  In the simulation it has a turn diameter of 23.7 feet.  Same results when doing the turn at max velocity and 1/2 velocity.

In older version there was also a problem where sometimes you would spin 90 degrees when applying the breaks.  I'll see if the latest code has that still.

[1] http://www.polarisatvforums.com/forums/atv-purchasing-price/1381-turning-radius-info-wanted.html
content.html:
Still need to do more testing, but I can see two issues from the limited testing that I have done already.

1) If you look at the trajectories above you can see one is very different from the others. it shouldn't diverge like that in such a controlled environment.
2) The turn radius still way to large. Not having a polaris ranger handy, I did a search online and found a message board [1] where people posted a turn diameter of around 13 and 14 feet for the 800 and 850 models. In the simulation it has a turn diameter of 23.7 feet. Same results when doing the turn at max velocity and 1/2 velocity.

In older version there was also a problem where sometimes you would spin 90 degrees when applying the breaks. I'll see if the latest code has that still.

[1] http://www.polarisatvforums.com/forums/atv-purchasing-price/1381-turning-radius-info-wanted.html

issue.title: DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns

content.raw: Same test as previous driving test but this time it moves for 2.5s in forwards and backwards direction.  When the breaks are applied at the end the wheel is also straightened out to ensure that it's in the neutral position before the next test starts.  Note how bad turning is when going in reverse.
content.html: Same test as previous driving test but this time it moves for 2.5s in forwards and backwards direction. When the breaks are applied at the end the wheel is also straightened out to ensure that it's in the neutral position before the next test starts. Note how bad turning is when going in reverse.

issue.title: DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns

content.raw: Image showing the path of the vehicle after it performs the same actions 16 times.  In each trial the vehicle starts with the steering wheel at 0 and is stationary.  It then sets the steering wheel to PI/4 and sets the speed to 1.0 and drives for 2.5s.

issue.title: DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns
DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns

content.raw: Please see pull request #278 and [gazebo_models pull request 38](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/38/polaris-rear-differential-parameter/diff). I've made several changes (wheel stiffness, added a rear differential for help on bumps). Note that grass has a lower friction coefficient, so your turning will not be quite as sharp as it is on the asphalt in vrc_task_1.
content.html: Please see pull request #278 and gazebo_models pull request 38. I've made several changes (wheel stiffness, added a rear differential for help on bumps). Note that grass has a lower friction coefficient, so your turning will not be quite as sharp as it is on the asphalt in vrc_task_1.

issue.title: DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns

content.raw:
Which branch of gazebo is this compatible with?  Looks like pull request #278 was merged into default and default drcsim doesn't seem to like default gazebo on my computer.  If gazebo default or some other version is working on your computer, could you post the output from "hg parent" for both gazeo and drcsim?  E.g.

hg parent
changeset:   2423:f8d6c379ad98
parent:      2417:ae950c054dcf
parent:      2370:dd6a9631218a

Thanks.

Which branch of gazebo is this compatible with? Looks like pull request #278 was merged into default and default drcsim doesn't seem to like default gazebo on my computer. If gazebo default or some other version is working on your computer, could you post the output from "hg parent" for both gazeo and drcsim? E.g.

hg parent changeset: 2423:f8d6c379ad98 parent: 2417:ae950c054dcf parent: 2370:dd6a9631218a

Thanks.

issue.title: DRC Vehicle can't make sharp turns

content.raw: It works for me with default gazebo and drcsim. What version of sandia-hand are you using? You will have a problem compiling default drcsim if you don't have the sandia-hand-nightly package installed.
content.html: It works for me with default gazebo and drcsim. What version of sandia-hand are you using? You will have a problem compiling default drcsim if you don't have the sandia-hand-nightly package installed.

As if the lighting is messed up. The ground is normal and maybe some of the houses (or they are just a lighter color).
